question: Which country houses the glacial lake "Jokulsarlon"?
explanation: Iceland houses the glacial lake "Jokulsarlon". Jokulsarlon, also known as "glacial river lagoon", is a large glacial lake in the southern part of Vatnajokull National Park, Iceland. Situated at the head of the Breidamerkurjokull glacier, it developed into a lake after the glacier started receding from the edge of the Atlantic Ocean. The lake has grown since then at varying rates because of the melting of the glaciers.
